meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a basilica.
meanings.sent1: The basilican architecture of the church was grand and impressive.
meanings.sent2: The basilican design of the building featured tall columns and a central nave.
meanings.sent3: The basilican layout of the library made finding books feel like a treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: Her basilican personality filled the room with a sense of calm and reverence.
meanings.sent5: The basilican aura of the garden transported visitors to a place of tranquility.

meanings.definition: Resembling or having the form of a basilica.
meanings.sent1: The basilican archway at the entrance gave the building an elegant touch.
meanings.sent2: The basilican windows of the house allowed ample natural light to fill the rooms.
meanings.sent3: The basilican shape of the cake made it look like a miniature cathedral.
meanings.sent4: His basilican voice echoed through the hall, commanding attention.
meanings.sent5: The basilican silhouette of the mountain against the sunset was breathtaking.
